body.p:
New Castle, Henry county Kentucky
December 10th 1862
To his Excellency, the Governor of Kentucky,
The undersigned, county judge of Henry county would respectfully represent:

That on the 2nd day of Decr 1862 one Wm. D. Mitchell and one James Deering were arrested on a warrant for unlawfully shooting one Fleet Goodridge and brought before the undersigned for examination on the charge -- That the accused were regularly examined by me, and the sd Wm. D. Mitchell was fully committed for murder in the first degree, and the sd Jas. Deering discharged.

That the sd Wm D. Mitchell has been forcibly rescued from the jail of this county and is now goig at large -- (see certificate and affidavit accompanying) In view of the foregoing facts, and on the application of as is made my special duty by statute, I request your eExcellency to offer a suitable reward for the apprehension of the sd Wm D Mitchell -- and yr petitioner as is duty bound &c
Jno A Monfort P J H c c

De
Said Mitchell is about twenty years of age, fiveabout five feet ten inches high, black hair, blue eyes, oblong visage, rather sparely made rather downcast look --

Henry Co.
$250 Reward
for Wm. D. Mitchell
Murder
Fleet Goodridge Jr
Offd. Decr 11. 1862
